thread.title: Stephen Curry's high school retires his jersey

title: Stephen Curry's high school retires his jersey
text:
Jan 24, 2017 at 8:23p ET 0Shares 
As the Golden State Warriors continue their lengthy East Coast trip, the team traveled to Charlotte, N.C., where they will face the Hornets on Wednesday night. 
On Tuesday, with no game scheduled, Warriors star Stephen Curry visited the Charlotte-area high school he attended and graduated from, Charlotte Christian School, for a special ceremony ‚Äî his own jersey retirement! Congrats @StephenCurry30 on having your high school jersey retired üëèüèΩ pic.twitter.com/wYZNhXvDkI 
‚Äî GoldenStateWarriors (@warriors) January 25, 2017 
If this recognition wasn‚Äôt enough, we also learned on Tuesday that Davidson College, his alma mater, has rebranded its student section in honor of Curry: Davidson's new student section, "Section 30" in honor of Steph Curry, branded w/sponsors Muscle Milk & Under Armour pic.twitter.com/CyF3TUKD4A 
‚Äî Darren Rovell (@darrenrovell) January 24, 2017 
If Steph keeps it up, he‚Äôll have his jersey hanging next to Rick Barry‚Äôs in the Warriors‚Äô rafters in no time.
